title: Southpaw typeface – is there such a thing?
content:

author: Frode Bo Helland

comments.content: [FF Oneleigh](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023113731/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_oneleigh_ot/) has some unexpected turns of the pen. The OpenType version was just [released today](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023113731/http:/www.fontshop.com/features/newsletters/apr09a/).

Especially the italic. Must confess I got the idea of its "southpaw" axis from Goudy's fascinating _Companion_ (1928, custom for _Woman's Home Companion_ magazine), which AFAIK has not been digitized.

[http://typophile.com/node/48843](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023113731/http:/typophile.com/node/48843 "http://typophile.com/node/48843")  
Overly long and somewhat contentious, but might be  
useful - especially John's trials starting from August 30.

hhp
Oneleigh is really something. Do you have pictures of Companion, Nick?
